testcase.name: System folders are expanded by default
testcase.summary: System folders are expanded by default

step.actions:
1. Open DefaultMailAccount, verify System folders (Inbox, Drafts, Sent items, Trash, Spam, My folders, File exchange) display

2. Open an addtional account if available, very Systems folders(Inbox, Drafts, Sent items, Trash, Spam, My folders) display
step.expectedresults:
1. System folders under DefaultMailAccount are expanded by default.

2. Systems folders under addtional account are expanded by default.

testcase.name: Personal folders are hidded by default
testcase.summary: Personal folders are hidded by default

step.actions:
1. Open DefaultMailAccount, verify personal foders are expanded or hidden

2. Open an addtional account if available, very personal fodlers are expand or hidden
step.expectedresults:
1. Personal folders under DefaultMailAccount are hidden under system folder or My folders.

2. Personal folders under addtional account are hidden under systems folder or My folders.

testcase.name: Inbox is automatically refreshed very 5 minutes.
testcase.summary: Inbox is automatically refreshed very 5 minutes.

step.actions:
1. Select Inbox, send the account itself some messages, wait for several minutes, check the change of Inbox folder

2. Send messages again to the account, check the changes of Inbox again when it is 5 minutes passed since the last refreshing

3. Repeat step 2, check the changes of Inbox every 5 mintues
step.expectedresults:
1. The new mesages are shown in Inbox, and the unread message account is auto-refreshed and shown correct; 

2.The new messages are shown in Inbox, and the unread message account is auto-refreshed and shown correct.

3. Inbox is auto-refreshed every 5 minutes.

testcase.name: Inbox is manually refreshed by click 'Refresh' button on Toolbar.
testcase.summary: Inbox is manually refreshed by click 'Refresh' button on Toolbar.

step.actions: 1. Select Inbox, send the account itself some messages, click 'Refresh' button on Mail Toolbar area
step.expectedresults: 1. The new mesages are shown in Inbox, and the unread message account is refreshed and shown correct.

testcase.name: (TBD)Able to add new folder under system folder
testcase.summary: Able to add new folder under system folder (Inbox, Drafts, Sent items, Trash, Spam)

step.actions:
1. Select Inbox, click 'New folder' button on Mail Toolbar

2. Repeat step 1 with other left systems folders(Drafts, Sent items, Trash, Spam)
step.expectedresults:
1. A new folder is shown under Inbox.

2. New folder is added to other system folders(Drafts, Sent items, Trash, Spam) successfully.

testcase.name: Unable to add duplicate folders.
testcase.summary: Unable to add duplicate folders.

step.actions:
1. Select a system folder, try to add duplicate folders at the same folder path

2. Select My folders, try to add duplicate folders at the same folder path
step.expectedresults:
1. Unable to add duplicate folders under system folder at the same folder path. A warning pops up telling "Folder xx exists"

2. Unable to add duplicate fodlers under My folders at the same folder path. A warning pops up telling "Folder xx exists".

testcase.name: Added folders are diaplayed alphabetically under the folder tree.
testcase.summary: Added folders are diaplayed alphabetically under the folder tree.

step.actions:
1. Add some folders at the same folder path under a system folder, check the display order of the added folders under the tree

2. Add some folders at the same folder path under My folders foder, check the display orfer of the added fodlers under the tree
step.expectedresults:
1. Added folders are displayed alphabetically under the folder tree of the selected system foder.

2. Added fodlers are dispalyed alphabetically under the fodler tree of My folders.

testcase.name: Move an empty folder
testcase.summary: Move an empty folder

step.actions: 1. Try to move an empty foder to a valid place
step.expectedresults: 1. The empty folder is moved and still empty.

testcase.name: Move a folder within some messages
testcase.summary: Move a folder within some messages

step.actions: 1. Move a folder with some messages in it
step.expectedresults: 1. The folder is moved successfully, and the messages are still shown in it. No message is missing.

testcase.name: Move a folder to a system folder
testcase.summary: Move a folder to a system folder

step.actions: 1. Try to move a folder to a system foder (Inbox, Drafts, Spent items, Trash, Spam)
step.expectedresults: The folder is moved to the system folder sucessfully.

testcase.name: Cannot move foder to an invalid target place
testcase.summary: Cannot move foder to an invalid target place

step.actions: 1. Select a foder and drag and drop it to an invalid target, e.g a target on message list, message reading pane
step.expectedresults: 1. The invalide target icon (the red icon) is shown when drag a folder on to an invalid target, and the folder is not moved after drop it there.

testcase.name: Delete icon and tooltip are shown when mouse over a personal folder.
testcase.summary: Delete icon and tooltip are shown when mouse over a personal folder.

step.actions: 1. Mouse over a personl folder
step.expectedresults: 1. The folder is highlighted; Delete icon 'x' and a tooltip is shown; the folder name is shown in the tooltip.

testcase.name: Empty Trash by 'Empty trash' button on toolbar
testcase.summary: Empty Trash by 'Empty trash' button on toolbar

step.actions:
1. Select Trash folder

2. Click 'Empty trash' button

3. Click 'Yes' button on the confirm
step.expectedresults:
1. 'Empty trash' button is shown on Mail toolbar;

2. Empty trash confirm pops up;

3. Trash folder is emptied.

testcase.name: Empty Trash when both Messages and sufolders are in Trash folder.
testcase.summary: Empty Trash when both Messages and sufolders are in Trash folder.

step.actions:
Preconditions:There are some messages in Trash folder, and there are subfolders under Trash with some messages in them.

1. Select Trash folder, click Trash bin icon next to Trash folder (or click on 'Empty Trash' button on Mail Toolbar)

2. Click 'Yes' on Empty Trash confirm
step.expectedresults:
1.Empty Trash confirm pops up, telling.....

2.Trash folder is emptied; the messages under Trash folder are deleted; the subfoders are deleted; the messages under the subfoders are deleted.

testcase.name: Empty Spam by 'Empty Spam' button on toolbar
testcase.summary: Empty Spam by 'Empty Spam' button on toolbar

step.actions:
1. Select Spam folder

2. Click 'Empty spam' button

3. Click 'Yes' button on the confirm
step.expectedresults:
1. 'Empty spam' button is shown on Mail toolbar;

2. Empty spam confirm pops up;

3. Spam folder is emptied.

testcase.name: Empty Spam when there are only empty subfolders in Spam folder
testcase.summary: Empty Spam when there are only empty subfolders in Spam folder

step.actions:
Preconditions:There is not any message, only some empty subfolders in Spam folder.

1. Select Spam folder, click Trash bin icon next to it (or click 'Empty spam' button on Mail Toolbar)

2. Click 'Yes' button on the Empty spam confirm
step.expectedresults:
1. Empty spam confirm pops up, telling "Do you really want to permanently delete all the messages and subfolders?".

2. Spam folder is emptied; all the subfolders are deleted.

testcase.name: Empty Spam when there are both messages and subfolders in Spam folder
testcase.summary: Empty Spam when there are both messages and subfolders in Spam folder

step.actions:
Preconditions:There are some messages in Spam folder, and there are subfolders under Spam with some messages in them.

1. Select Spam folder, click Trash bin icon next to Trash folder (or click on 'Empty Spam' button on Mail Toolbar)

2. Click 'Yes' on Empty Spam confirm
step.expectedresults:
1. Empty spam confirm pops up, telling"Do you really want to permanently delete all the messages and subfolders?''.

2. Spam folder is emptied; the messages under Spam folder are deleted; the subfolders are deleted; the messages under subfolders are deleted.

testcase.name: Message content is shown on currently opened tab when select a message.
testcase.summary: Message content is shown on currently opened tab when select a message.

step.actions:
1. When there is not any message shown on the default tab, click on a message on message list

2. When there a message is opened in a tab, select any other message on message list
step.expectedresults:
1. The message content is shown on the defaut tab.

2. The selected message is shown on currectly opened tab.

testcase.summary: Click on Enlarge reading pane icon will enlarge reading pane and hide message list.

testcase.summary: Click on Show message list icon will show message list and enlarge reading pane.

2. Click Show message list icon
step.expectedresults: 2. Message list is shown and reading pane returns to be normal.

testcase.name: Left and Right arrow are shown when there are enough tab views.
testcase.summary: Left and Right arrow are shown when there are enough tab views.

step.actions: 1. Open many message tab views till the tabs cannot be shown completely on thhe header of reading pane
step.expectedresults: 1. Left and Right arrows are shown when there are many enough opened tabs.

testcase.summary: Click on the Left arrow shows next hidden tab view from the left.

1. Click on the Left arrow
step.expectedresults: 1. A left tab is shown on the left and the mostright bab is hidden.

testcase.summary: Click on the Right arrow shows next hidden tab view from the right.

step.actions:
Preconditions: The Left and Right arrows are shown on the header of Read pane header.

1. Click on the Right arrow
step.expectedresults: 1. A right tab is shown on the right and the mostleft bab is hidden.

testcase.name: Left arrow is disabled when the mostleft tab view is visible.
testcase.summary: Left arrow is disabled when the mostleft tab view is visible.

step.actions:
Preconditions: The Left and Right arrows are shown on the header of Read pane header.

1. Click on the Left arrow till the mostleft tab is shown on Reading pane
step.expectedresults: The Left arrow is disabled.

testcase.name: Right arrow is disabled when the mostright tab view is visible.
testcase.summary: Right arrow is disabled when the mostright tab view is visible.

step.actions:
Preconditions: The Left and Right arrows are shown on the header of Read pane header.

1. Click on the Right arrow till the mosright tab is shown on Reading pane
step.expectedresults: The Right arrow is disabled.

testcase.name: Tooltip and delete icon are shown when mouse over a tab.
testcase.summary: Tooltip and delete icon are shown when mouse over a tab.

2. Mouse over the tab
step.expectedresults: 1. A tooltip is shown and email title is shown in the tooltip; Delete icon 'x' is showon.

testcase.summary: Close tab view by clicking 'x' icon.

step.actions:
1. Open a message in a tab view

2. Mouse over the tab, click the 'x' button on it
step.expectedresults: 2. The tab view is closed.

testcase.name: Default picture is displayed for the sender exists in address book and doesn't have a picture
testcase.summary: Default picture is displayed for the sender exists in address book and doesn't have a picture

step.actions:
Preconditions: A sender exists in test account's address book and doesn't have set a picture.

1. The contact send test account a message;

2. Test account receives the message, and open it on reading pane, check the picture field of the message
step.expectedresults: 2. The default picture is displayed for the sender in Picture field.

testcase.name: Default picture is displayed for the sender that doesn't exist in address book
testcase.summary: Default picture is displayed for the sender that doesn't exist in address book

step.actions:
Preconditions: A sender doesn't exist in test account's address book.

1. The sender sends test account a message;

2. Test account receives the message, and open it on reading pane, check the picture field of the message
step.expectedresults: 2. The default picture is displayed for the sender in Picture field.

testcase.name: Nothing is shown when mouse over an email addresses of the sender stored in Address book
testcase.summary: Nothing is shown when mouse over an email addresses of the sender stored in Address book

step.actions:
Preconditions: There is a message from a sender that is stored in test account's address book.

1. Open the message from a sender that is stored in test accoutn's address book

2. Mouse over the sender
step.expectedresults: 2. The sender is not highlighted and no toolitp appears.

testcase.name: Nothing is shown shwn mouse over an email address of the recipients stored in Address book
testcase.summary: Nothing is shown shwn mouse over an email address of the recipients stored in Address book

step.actions:
Preconditions: There is a message that has a recipient that is stored in test account's address book in CC field.

1. Open the message that has a recipent that is stored in test account's addesss book in CC field

2. Mouse over the sender
step.expectedresults: 2. The sender is not highlighted and no toolitp appears.

testcase.name: Add contact icon is shown for email address of sender or recipient not stored in Address book
testcase.summary: Add contact icon is shown for email address of sender or recipient not stored in Address book.

step.actions:
1. Select a message from a sender that is not stored in Address book

2. The message is shown on reading pane, mouse over the sender's email address

3. Click on the email address

4. Select a message with a recipient not stored in test account's address book, mouse over the recipient's email address

5. Click on the email address
step.expectedresults:
2. The email address is highlighted; Add contact icon '+' is shown next to the email address.

3. 'Save email address' dialog pops up.

4. The email address is highlighted; Add contact icon '+' is shown next to the email address.

5. 'Save email address' dialog pops up.

testcase.name: Save email address as a new contact when both first name and last are empty.
testcase.summary: Save email address as a new contact when both first name and last are empty.

step.actions:
1. Select a message from a sender not stored in test account's address book

2. Click on the sender to open Save email address dialog

3. Clear the email address from 'First name' field, and don't enter in 'Last name' field, click 'Add as new' button
step.expectedresults:
2. The sender's email address is populated in Email address and First name field; user cannot edit or delete the email address in Email address field; user can edit the email address in First name field.

3. The sender is added to address book with email address as display name.

testcase.name: Save email address as a new contact when only has first name.
testcase.summary: Save email address as a new contact when only has first name.

step.actions:
1. Select a message from a sender not stored in test account's address book

2. Click on the sender to open Save email address dialog

3. Define a First name, but don't enter in 'Last name' field, click 'Add as new' button
step.expectedresults:
2. The email address is populated in Email address and First name fields; user cannot edit or delete the email address in Email address field; user can edit the email address in First name field.

3. The email address is added to address book with first name as display name.

testcase.name: Save email address as a new contact when only has last name.
testcase.summary: Save email address as a new contact when only has last name.

step.actions:
1. Select a message from a sender not stored in test account's address book

2. Click on the sender to open Save email address dialog

3. Clear the email address from 'First name' field, and define last name, click 'Add as new' button
step.expectedresults:
2. The sender's email address is populated in Email address and First name fields; user cannot edit or delete the email address in Email address field; user can edit the email address in First name field.

3.The sender is added to address book with last name as display name.

testcase.name: Save email address to an existing contact.
testcase.summary: Save email address to an existing contact.

step.actions:
1. Select a message from a sender not stored in test account's address book

2. Click on the sender to open Save email address dialog

3. Select an exisiting contact from contact list, click 'Add to selected contact' button
step.expectedresults: 3. The sender's email address is added to the selected contact and shown in contact list.

testcase.name: Contacts on exisitng contact list are sorted by first name alphabetically.
testcase.summary: Contacts on exisitng contact list are sorted by first name alphabetically.

step.actions:
1. Select a message from a sender not stored in test account's address book

2. Click on the sender to open Save email address dialog

3. Check the display order of existing contacts
step.expectedresults: 3. The contact is diaplayed by first name alphabetically.

testcase.name: Scroll bar is shown when there are enough contacts in address book.
testcase.summary: Scroll bar is shown when there are enough contacts in address book.

2. Click on the sender to open Save email address dialog

3. Look for scoll bar on contact list on the dialog
step.expectedresults: 3. Scroll bar is shown on the contact list when there are many enough contacts in address book.

testcase.name: Can scorll contact list via scroll bar whesn scroll bar is avalialbe.
testcase.summary: Can scorll contact list via scroll bar whesn scroll bar is avalialbe.

step.expectedresults: 3. User can scroll the scroll bar by mousewheel or up/down arrow.

testcase.name: Check Delete confirmation dialg.
testcase.summary: Check Delete confirmation dialg.

step.actions:
Preconditons: 2-panel view is selected.

1. Open Trash folder, unselect any message, click 'Delete' buton on Mail Toolbar

2. Close the waring, select one message, click 'Delete' button on Mail Toolbar

3. Close the confirm, select multiple messages, click 'Delete' button on Mail Toolbar
step.expectedresults:
1. "Selection error" warning pops up, telling "Select at least one message".

2. 'Delete messages" confirm pops up, telling "Do you really want to permanent delete 1 message(s)?"; 'Yes' and 'No' button are shown on the confirm.

3. "Delete messages" confirm pops up, telling "Do you really want to permanent delete x message(s)?"; 'Yes' and 'No' button are shown on the confirm.

testcase.name: Click Yes button on the Delete confirm dialog will delete the message.
testcase.summary: Click Yes button on the Delete confirm dialog will delete the message.

step.actions:
Preconditions: 2-panel view is selected.

1. Open Trash folder, select one message, click 'Delete' button on Mail Tool bar

2. Click 'Yes' button on the confirm

3. Repeat step 1 to 2 with mulitple messages in Trash folder
step.expectedresults:
1. Delete confirm pops up.

2. The message is permanently deleted from Trash folder.

3. The messages are permanently deleted from Trash folder.

testcase.name: Click No button on the Delete confirm dialog will cancel deletion.
testcase.summary: Click No button on the Delete confirm dialog will cancel deletion.

step.actions:
Preconditions: 2-panel view is selected.

1. Open Trash folder, select one message, click 'Delete' button on Mail Tool bar

2. Click 'No' button on the confirm

3. Repeat step 1 to 2 with mulitple messages in Trash folder
step.expectedresults:
1. Delete confirm pops up.

2. The message is still in Trash fodler, it is not deleted.

3. The messages are still in Trash fodler, they are not deleted.

testcase.name: Click No button on the Spam confirm will cancel spam.
testcase.summary: Click No button on the Spam confirm will cancel spam.

step.actions:

step.expectedresults:

testcase.name: Check the folder list of Move to display.

Preconditions: 2-panel view is selected.

testcase.name: Move message(s) to a default(system) folder.
testcase.summary: Move message(s) to a default(system) folder.

Preconditions: 2-panel view is selected.

1. Open a folder that has some messages, select one or multiple messages

2. Open 'Move to' list, select a default folder(Inbox, Drafts, Sent items, Spam, Trash)

3. Click 'Yes' button on the confirm
step.expectedresults:
2. 'Move messages' confirm pops up, telling "Do you really want to move x message(s)?"; 'Yes' and 'No' button is shown on the confirm.

3. The message(s) are removed from current folder, and moved to the selected default folder successfully.

testcase.name: Move message(s) to a personal folder.

2. Open 'Move to' list, select a personal folder (under 'My folders')

step.expectedresults:
2. 'Move messages' confirm pops up, telling "Do you really want to move x message(s)?"; 'Yes' and 'No' button is shown on the confirm.

testcase.name: Move message(s) to a subfolder under default folder
testcase.summary: Move message(s) to a subfolder under default folder.

6. Set List Size as '100' and save, then open Mail, check message list of the same folder
step.expectedresults:
4. The messages in the folder are paged, the maximum number of messages listed in per page is the number you have set.

5. The messages in the folder are paged, the maximum number of messages listed in per page is 1.

6. The messages in the folder are paged, the maximum number of messages listed in per page is 100.

3. The signature without signature body is added to signature list.

4. A blank signature is added to message body.

testcase.name: Add a signature with some text in 'Signature' body
testcase.summary: Add a signature with some text in 'Signature' body

step.actions:
1. Open Settings->Email->'Signatures' section

2. Click 'Add' button, input signature name and add some text in signature body

3. Click 'Save' button

4. Open a message compose window, select the signature from 'Signature' dropdown
step.expectedresults:
3. The signature without signature body is added to signature list.

4. The signature text is added to message body.

testcase.name: Modify Default signature set

4. Click 'Save'

5. Compose a new message, verify if the 'Default' signature change is working
step.expectedresults:
4. The change of 'Default' signature is saved.

5. The change of 'Default' signature is working correctly.

step.expectedresults:

4. The format of the signature is updated.

step.expectedresults:
